frameDefinitions: A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.
Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking.
frameExamples: Will you <t>help</t> the Government find your brother?
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
I <t>befriended</t> the little pony by giving him a piece of apple.
CSTR actively <t>collaborates</t> with the Departments of Artificial Intelligence  and Physics.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Benefited_party</fen> receives a benefit from the action of the <fen>Helper</fen>.
The <fen>Helper</fen> performs some action that benefits the <fen>Benefited_party</fen>.
The desirable state of affairs that the <fen>Benefited_party</fen> is involved in and which is enabled by the <fen>Helper</fen>.
This role identifies a <fen>Focal_entity</fen> involved in achieving the <fen>Goal</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Assistance occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Assistance occurs.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
The individual whose relationship with <fen>Partner_1</fen> changes.
The individuals whose relationship is changing.
The time when the relationship changes.
Where the relationship is formed.

When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically  less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the <fen>Partners</fen> are collaborating.
This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Partners</fen> are engaged in their collaboration.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the collaboration occurs.
listRoleExamples: Jack helped Jill <fex>climb Mt. Everest</fex>.
Whoever didn't cook has to help <fex>with the dishes</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> is married to Sue.
John is <fex>Sue's</fex> husband.
<fex>John and Sue</fex> are married.
She married Stephen <fex>last summer</fex>.
We married <fex>in a gazebo</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> collaborated with Chief Wiggum
Britain is collaborating <fex>with France and West Germany</fex> in the development of anti-tank missiles
The two artists collaborated <fex>on a mosaic</fex>.
<fex>Smithers and Chief Wiggum</fex> collaborated well
<fex>Last year</fex> some of my colleagues collaborated in the design of a theme-park.
<fex>In New Braunfels</fex> Paul and John collaborated in the design of a new Guggenheim
